title: Keep Android Open
summary:
"This Week in F-Droid" (TWIF) raises an urgent alarm regarding Google's uncancelled plans to lock down Android. F-Droid notes a public misconception that these plans were abandoned, asserting that the initiatives announced last August are still on track, threatening to make Google the "gate-keeper" of user devices.

To counter this, F-Droid has begun featuring warning banners in its F-Droid and F-Droid Basic clients, encouraging users to contact local authorities. Other app downloaders like IzzyOnDroid and Obtainium are joining this effort.

Development for F-Droid Basic continues, with release 2.0-alpha3 introducing features like updated translations, CSV export of installed apps, install history, a mirror chooser, and Material Design 3 adaptations.

Key app updates include Conversations and Quicksy exploring a method to interface directly with Google Play Services, aiming for fully FLOSS versions compatible with both F-Droid and Play Store. Dolphin Emulator received substantial updates, Image Toolbox added AI tools, and ProtonVPN transitioned entirely to WireGuard and Stealth protocols, reducing app size. Offi now requires Android 8+, and SimpleEmail saw a fix-focused update after a two-year pause.

Lastly, the report lists 5 apps that were removed and 1 new app, NeoDB You, that was added, alongside updates for 287 other applications.
chinese_title: 保持安卓开放
chinese_summary:
《本周F-Droid》(TWIF)就谷歌尚未取消的安卓系统锁定计划发出了紧急警告。F-Droid指出公众普遍误解这些计划已被放弃，并强调去年八月宣布的举措仍在按计划进行，威胁要让谷歌成为用户设备的“看门人”。

为应对此威胁，F-Droid已开始在其F-Droid和F-Droid Basic客户端中显示警告横幅，鼓励用户联系当地主管部门。IzzyOnDroid和Obtainium等其他应用下载器也正加入此项行动。

F-Droid Basic的开发工作仍在继续，2.0-alpha3版本引入了更新的翻译、已安装应用的CSV导出、安装历史记录、镜像选择器以及Material Design 3适配等功能。

主要应用更新包括Conversations和Quicksy正在探索一种直接与Google Play Services对接的方法，旨在实现兼容F-Droid和Play Store的完全FLOSS版本。Dolphin Emulator获得了重大更新，Image Toolbox添加了AI工具，ProtonVPN已完全过渡到WireGuard和Stealth协议，从而减小了应用体积。Offi现在要求安卓8+系统，SimpleEmail在两年暂停后进行了一次以修复为主的更新。

最后，报告列出了5个被移除的应用和1个新加入的应用NeoDB You，以及287个其他应用的更新。

title: Trump's global tariffs struck down by US Supreme Court
summary:
After the US Supreme Court reportedly struck down his global tariffs, President Trump announced new tariffs, notably a "NEW 15% TAX" on the American people, drawing immediate and varied reactions from lawmakers.

Democrat Congressman Ted Lieu criticized Trump, stating he "feels hurt" by the Supreme Court ruling and is retaliating against Americans with "temporary tariffs" that Democrats plan to challenge and eventually eliminate. California Governor Gavin Newsom echoed this, calling the 15% tax a burden on Americans and suggesting Trump's disregard for their well-being.

In a more nuanced stance, Democratic Senator John Fetterman expressed an "open mind" about tariffs. He supports using them against China and urged Trump to collaborate with lawmakers but questioned the imposition of tariffs on US allies. Republican Senate Majority Leader John Thune generally affirmed tariffs as an "important and effective tool" for fair competition with foreign nations.
chinese_title: 特朗普全球关税被美国最高法院推翻
chinese_summary:
美国最高法院据报道推翻了他的全球关税后，特朗普总统宣布了新关税，其中引人注目的是对美国人民征收的“新的15%税”，此举立即引发了国会议员们多样的反应。

民主党国会议员刘云平批评特朗普，称他“因最高法院裁决而感到受伤”，正用“临时关税”报复美国民众，而民主党计划对此提出挑战并最终将其取消。加州州长加文·纽森对此表示认同，称这项15%的税是对美国人的负担，并暗示特朗普漠视他们的福祉。

民主党参议员约翰·费特曼则持更为审慎的立场，对关税表示“开放态度”。他支持对中国使用关税，并敦促特朗普与立法者合作，但质疑对美国盟友征收关税的做法。共和党参议院多数党领袖约翰·图恩普遍肯定关税是与外国进行公平竞争的“重要而有效的工具”。

title: Facebook is cooked
summary:
After an eight-year absence, the author revisited Facebook, intending to find a neighborhood group, but was instead appalled by the content on their main feed, declaring the platform "cooked." They observed a "slop conveyor belt" predominantly featuring AI-generated "thirst traps" of young women in revealing clothing, pushed by the algorithm despite no prior engagement with such pages.

Beyond these, the feed included other forms of engagement bait: an AI video depicting a wholesome police interaction and a relationship sketch deemed "lizard-brain-rot." The author highlighted Meta's suggested AI questions for these posts as problematic, ranging from sexist to nonsensical. Many posts were clearly AI-generated, with obvious errors, yet comments often failed to acknowledge this, suggesting potential bot activity.

The author questioned if this was an anomaly due to their long inactivity but suspected it reflected a broader decline in Facebook's content, potentially worse for lonely users. They contrasted this pervasive "slop" on the *main feed* with spam issues on other platforms. The final straw was encountering AI-generated images that appeared to depict girls around 14 years old, prompting the author to immediately log off, vowing to only return if absolutely necessary for essential updates.
chinese_title: Facebook 完蛋了
chinese_summary:
八年未用后，作者重新登录Facebook，本想找个社区群组，却被其主页动态的内容惊呆了，直言该平台“完蛋了”。他们看到一条“垃圾传送带”，上面充斥着大量AI生成的、衣着暴露的年轻女性“吸睛诱饵”，尽管作者此前从未与这类页面互动过，算法却不断推送。

除此之外，动态中还有其他形式的互动诱饵：一段AI生成的描绘“和谐警民互动”的视频，以及一个被认为是“脑残内容”的感情小品。作者指出，Meta为这些帖子推荐的AI问题也很有问题，从性别歧视到毫无意义，应有尽有。许多帖子明显是AI生成，错误百出，但评论中却鲜有人提及，这暗示了潜在的机器人活动。

作者质疑这是否是由于自己长期不活跃导致的异常现象，但他们怀疑这反映了Facebook内容质量的普遍下滑，对孤独的用户而言可能更糟。他们将主页动态中这种普遍存在的“垃圾内容”与其他平台上的垃圾信息问题进行了对比。最后一根稻草是他们看到了似乎描绘14岁左右女孩的AI生成图片，这促使作者立即退出，并发誓除非绝对必要获取重要更新，否则绝不再登录。

title: I Verified My LinkedIn Identity. Here's What I Handed Over
summary:
The author, seeking LinkedIn's blue verification badge, discovered the process is handled by Persona Identities, Inc., a US company. For a three-minute verification, Persona collects extensive personal data, including full name, passport photo, selfie, facial geometry (biometrics), NFC chip data, national ID, email, phone, address, device information, geolocation, and even behavioral biometrics like hesitation detection.

Persona also cross-references users against government databases, credit agencies, and utility companies. Crucially, it uses uploaded identity documents and selfies to train its AI, citing "legitimate interests" rather than user consent. While LinkedIn receives limited data, Persona shares the full data with 17 subprocessors—16 US-based (including AI companies like Anthropic and OpenAI, and AWS) and one Canadian—with no EU subprocessors.

This means European users' data, even if stored in Germany, is subject to the US CLOUD Act, allowing US law enforcement to demand it regardless of server location, potentially under gag orders. The EU-US Data Privacy Framework is deemed fragile, based on a revocable Executive Order. The author emphasizes the risk of unchangeable biometric data being held indefinitely by US legal mandates. Persona’s terms cap liability for breaches at $50 and enforce US arbitration.

The author advises existing verified users to request and delete their data from Persona and contact their DPO to object to AI training, cautioning others to weigh the value of a cosmetic badge against profound personal data exposure.
chinese_title: 我验证了领英身份：以下是我提交的资料
chinese_summary:
作者在申请领英（LinkedIn）的蓝色验证徽章时，发现该流程由一家美国公司Persona Identities, Inc.处理。为了这短短三分钟的验证，Persona收集了大量的个人数据，包括全名、护照照片、自拍照、面部几何数据（生物识别信息）、NFC芯片数据、国民身份识别信息、电子邮件、电话、地址、设备信息、地理位置，甚至包括行为生物识别信息，如犹豫检测。

Persona还会将用户数据与政府数据库、信用机构和公用事业公司进行交叉比对。更重要的是，它利用上传的身份文件和自拍照来训练其AI，声称是出于“合法利益”而非用户同意。虽然领英收到的数据有限，但Persona将完整数据共享给17家分包处理商——其中16家位于美国（包括Anthropic和OpenAI等AI公司，以及AWS），一家位于加拿大，且没有欧盟的分包处理商。

这意味着欧洲用户的数据，即使存储在德国，也受美国《云法案》（CLOUD Act）的约束，该法案允许美国执法部门无论服务器位于何处，都可以要求获取这些数据，甚至可能在“封口令”下进行。欧盟-美国数据隐私框架被认为脆弱，因为它基于一项可撤销的行政命令。作者强调，不可更改的生物识别数据被美国法律强制要求无限期持有，存在风险。Persona的服务条款将数据泄露的责任上限设为50美元，并强制执行美国的仲裁。

作者建议现有已验证用户向Persona请求删除其数据，并联系其数据保护官（DPO）反对AI训练，同时告诫其他人权衡一个表面化的徽章与深远的个人数据暴露之间的价值。

title: I found a Vulnerability. They found a Lawyer
summary:
A platform engineer and diving instructor discovered a critical vulnerability in a major diving insurer's member portal. The system used sequential numeric user IDs combined with a static default password, which was never enforced to be changed, allowing unauthorized access to sensitive personal data, including that of minors, without rate limiting or MFA.

Following standard responsible disclosure protocols, the researcher notified CSIRT Malta and the organization on April 28, 2025, proposing a 30-day embargo. The organization acknowledged the issue, initiated password resets, and planned 2FA rollout. However, their response quickly turned hostile. Their Data Privacy Officers' law firm accused the researcher of creating "additional complexities" by involving authorities and "threatening" public disclosure. They demanded the researcher sign a declaration (an NDA) to keep the entire matter "strictly confidential" under threat of legal action, citing Maltese criminal law.

The researcher refused the NDA, agreeing only to delete retained data, emphasizing the importance of transparency in coordinated disclosure and the NCVDP requirement to involve CSIRT Malta. The organization reiterated its legal threats, citing Article 337E of the Maltese Criminal Code and warning against any public mention. They also controversially blamed users for not changing their default passwords, despite GDPR stipulating controller responsibility for data security.

While the vulnerability is now fixed, the researcher has not received confirmation that affected users, particularly parents of minors, were notified, a potential GDPR Article 34 violation. The article highlights a common "chilling effect" where organizations prioritize reputation management over transparent user protection, arguing legal threats themselves cause reputation damage. It concludes with recommendations for both organizations (publish CVD policies, thank researchers, don't blame users) and researchers (involve CSIRT, document everything, know your rights).
chinese_title: 我发现了一个漏洞。他们找了一个律师。
chinese_summary:
一名平台工程师兼潜水教练在一家主要潜水保险公司的会员门户中发现了一个严重漏洞。该系统使用连续的数字用户ID与静态默认密码相结合，且从未强制要求更改密码，导致未经授权即可访问敏感个人数据，包括未成年人的数据，并且没有速率限制或多因素认证。

遵循标准的负责任披露协议，研究人员于2025年4月28日通知了马耳他计算机安全事件响应小组（CSIRT Malta）和该组织，提议30天的信息披露禁令。该组织承认了问题，启动了密码重置，并计划推出双因素认证。然而，他们的回应很快变得充满敌意。他们的数据隐私官的律师事务所指责研究人员通过涉及当局制造了“额外的复杂性”，并“威胁”要公开披露。他们要求研究人员签署一份声明（一份保密协议），以将整个事件“严格保密”，否则将面临法律行动的威胁，并援引了马耳他刑法。

研究人员拒绝了保密协议，仅同意删除保留的数据，强调了协同披露中透明度的重要性，以及国家漏洞协调披露政策（NCVDP）要求涉及CSIRT Malta的规定。该组织重申了其法律威胁，援引马耳他刑法第337E条，并警告不得公开提及此事。他们还争议性地指责用户没有更改默认密码，尽管通用数据保护条例（GDPR）规定了数据控制者对数据安全的责任。

尽管漏洞现已修复，研究人员尚未收到受影响用户，特别是未成年人父母已被通知的确认，这可能违反了通用数据保护条例（GDPR）第34条。文章强调了一种常见的“寒蝉效应”，即组织将声誉管理置于透明的用户保护之上，并认为法律威胁本身就会损害声誉。文章最后向组织（发布协同漏洞披露政策，感谢研究人员，不要指责用户）以及研究人员（涉及CSIRT，记录一切，了解自己的权利）提出了建议。

title: Ggml.ai joins Hugging Face to ensure the long-term progress of Local AI
summary:
On February 20, 2026, ggml.ai, the founding team behind llama.cpp, announced their acquisition by Hugging Face. This strategic partnership aims to ensure the long-term progress and open nature of local AI. Georgi Gerganov and his team will continue to full-time lead, maintain, and support the ggml and llama.cpp libraries, which will remain open and community-driven.

The core mission of ggml.ai has been to establish ggml as the standard for efficient local AI inference, enabling private and accessible AI on consumer hardware. Hugging Face has been a significant partner, contributing core functionalities, building an inference server, introducing multi-modal support, integrating llama.cpp into its platform, and improving GGUF compatibility. Formalizing this successful collaboration ensures its future strength and sustainability.

For the open-source projects and community, the day-to-day operations will largely remain unchanged. The ggml team will dedicate 100% of their time to the projects, and the community will continue to make autonomous technical decisions. Hugging Face will provide long-term resources, fostering growth and new opportunities.

Future technical efforts will focus on achieving seamless "single-click" integration with the Hugging Face transformers library for wider model support and quality control. Additionally, there will be an emphasis on improving user experience and packaging of ggml-based software to make local inference ubiquitous and competitive with cloud solutions. The shared long-term vision is to build the ultimate efficient inference stack, making open-source superintelligence accessible to the world. The announcement was met with widespread positive feedback from the community.
chinese_title: Ggml.ai 加入 Hugging Face，确保本地AI的长期发展
chinese_summary:
2026年2月20日，llama.cpp 背后的创始团队 ggml.ai 宣布被 Hugging Face 收购。此次战略合作旨在确保本地AI的长期发展和开放性。Georgi Gerganov 及其团队将继续全职领导、维护并支持 ggml 和 llama.cpp 库，这些库将保持开源并由社区驱动。

ggml.ai 的核心使命一直是将 ggml 打造为高效本地AI推理的标准，从而在消费级硬件上实现私密且可访问的AI。Hugging Face 一直是重要的合作伙伴，贡献了核心功能、构建了推理服务器、引入了多模态支持、将 llama.cpp 集成到其平台中，并改进了 GGUF 兼容性。此次成功合作的正式化，将确保其未来的实力和可持续性。

对于开源项目和社区而言，日常运营将基本保持不变。ggml 团队将百分之百地投入到这些项目中，社区将继续自主做出技术决策。Hugging Face 将提供长期资源，促进发展并创造新的机遇。

未来的技术工作将侧重于实现与 Hugging Face transformers 库的无缝“一键式”集成，以实现更广泛的模型支持和质量控制。此外，还将强调改进基于 ggml 软件的用户体验和打包方式，使本地推理无处不在，并与云解决方案具有竞争力。双方共同的长期愿景是构建极致高效的推理栈，使开源超人工智能普惠全球。该公告得到了社区的广泛积极反馈。

title: The path to ubiquitous AI (17k tokens/sec)
summary:
Taalas addresses the high latency and astronomical cost hindering ubiquitous AI adoption by developing a platform for transforming any AI model into custom silicon, called "Hardcore Models." This approach yields solutions an order of magnitude faster, cheaper, and lower power than software implementations.

Their philosophy rests on three principles: total specialization, producing optimal silicon for each model; merging storage and computation on a single chip at DRAM density, eliminating the traditional memory-compute boundary; and radical simplification, removing the need for complex technologies like HBM, advanced packaging, or liquid cooling.

Taalas' first product is a hard-wired Llama 3.1 8B model (HC1), achieving 17,000 tokens/sec per user, which is nearly 10X faster, 20X cheaper, and consumes 10X less power than current state-of-the-art GPUs. While this first-generation platform uses custom 3-bit/6-bit quantization, their upcoming second-generation silicon (HC2) will adopt standard 4-bit floating-point formats.

Future plans include a mid-sized reasoning LLM on HC1 this spring, followed by a frontier LLM on the higher-density HC2 platform in winter. Taalas aims to enable new applications by providing sub-millisecond, near-zero-cost inference, encouraging developers to experiment with their beta service. This achievement, developed by a lean team of 24 with only $30M spent, underscores a focus on substance, craft, and disciplined innovation over brute-force capital.
chinese_title: 泛在AI之路 (17k tokens/秒)
chinese_summary:
Taalas addresses the high latency and astronomical cost hindering ubiquitous AI adoption by developing a platform for transforming any AI model into custom silicon, called "Hardcore Models." This approach yields solutions an order of magnitude faster, cheaper, and lower power than software implementations.

Their philosophy rests on three principles: total specialization, producing optimal silicon for each model; merging storage and computation on a single chip at DRAM density, eliminating the traditional memory-compute boundary; and radical simplification, removing the need for complex technologies like HBM, advanced packaging, or liquid cooling.

Taalas' first product is a hard-wired Llama 3.1 8B model (HC1), achieving 17,000 tokens/sec per user, which is nearly 10X faster, 20X cheaper, and consumes 10X less power than current state-of-the-art GPUs. While this first-generation platform uses custom 3-bit/6-bit quantization, their upcoming second-generation silicon (HC2) will adopt standard 4-bit floating-point formats.

Future plans include a mid-sized reasoning LLM on HC1 this spring, followed by a frontier LLM on the higher-density HC2 platform in winter. Taalas aims to enable new applications by providing sub-millisecond, near-zero-cost inference, encouraging developers to experiment with their beta service. This achievement, developed by a lean team of 24 with only $30M spent, underscores a focus on substance, craft, and disciplined innovation over brute-force capital.
